title: Font - Monty Python and the Holy Grail
content:
Hi everybody,

Does anyone know a font that looks like the one created for the title of this "Monty Python and the Holy Grail" poster ?

Thank you for all the help you can provide !

Tristan

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013447im_/http:/typophile.com/files/436522_3642.jpg)
author: Tristan Isaac

comments.content:
The info at the bottom looks like Helvetica.  
As for the rest the \_Holy Grail\_ has some similarity to some of the "pirate" fonts like Blackmoor [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/blackmoor/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/blackmoor/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/blackmoor/") Windlass [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/windlass/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/windlass/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/windlass/") and captain Kidd [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/captain-kidd/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/captain-kidd/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/captain-kidd/")  
Don

As for the bouncy letters in \_ANOTHER FILM COMPLETELY\_ you could substitute a font like Schnitzle

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013447im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SchnitzleAsANOTHER_6221.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/astigmatic/schnitzle-aoe/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/astigmatic/schnitzle-aoe/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/astigmatic/schnitzle-aoe/")  
Similar bouncy style letters, but in a narrower width, are found in Rather Jazzy [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/rather-both/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/rather-both/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/rather-both/") and Lemon Yellow Sun [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hanoded/lemon-yellow-sun/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hanoded/lemon-yellow-sun/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hanoded/lemon-yellow-sun/")  
Don

The lettering in \_AND NOW! AT LAST!\_ has a sort of Looney Tunes style. It would be difficult to create the overlap effect with a font, but Marvin Shadow captures the spirit

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013447im_/http:/typophile.com/files/MarvinShadowAsAND_5884.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/marvin/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/marvin/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/marvin/") For more fonts similar to Marvin go to [http://www.identifont.com/find?font=marvin&q=Go](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013447/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=marvin&q=Go "http://www.identifont.com/find?font=marvin&q=Go") and follow the link to \_Show more similar fonts\_.  
Don

For \_MONTY PYTHON\_ same fonts as previous post plus Thats All Folks Outline Bold, which manages to have an element of overlap

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013447im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ThatsAllFolksOutlineBoldAsMONTY_4743.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/comicraft/thats-all-folks/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/comicraft/thats-all-folks/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/comicraft/thats-all-folks/")  
don
